item.title: Addition and Subtraction
item.description: To add rational expressions: determine the common denominator, then express each fraction in the common denominator, then add the numerators, then simplify (if possible). Example $$s\frac{3a}{7b}\frac{5}{8b^2}$$e $$s\frac{24ab+35}{56b^2}; b\ne 0$$e

item.title: Graphs of Rational Functions
item.description: TL;DR: If a term is removed during simplification, then it becomes a hole, but if not it becoems an asymptote. (or, a restriction is added when it is removed) If a graph is restricted from simplification from factorization, a hole occurs at that point. Example $$sg(x)=\frac{x^2+7x+12}{x+3}$$e $$sg(x)=x+4; x\ne-3$$e Since $sx$e cannot be $s-3$e , there is a hole in the line at $sx=-3$e . But, asymptotes occur instead of holes if the restrictions are zeroes after simplification.

item.title: Multiplication and Division
item.description: To multiply rational expressions: factor the expression, then divide out common factors, then multiply the denominators (produce a GCF), then merge into a single rational expression. To divide rational expressions, do the same as multiplying but use the reciprocal of the second one instead. Remember to add restrictions. Add restrictions right after or during when you simplify that part, and not after you finish the whole operation. This reduces mistakes.

item.title: Simplfication of Polynomials
item.description: Simplifications of polynomials involve combining like terms. Example $s\frac{3x+2}{3y-1}$e where $sx=-2$e , and $sy=1$e is: $$s\frac{3x+2}{3y-1}$$e $$s=\frac{4}{2}$$e $$s=2$$e Example The non-permissible value(s) for $s\frac{x^3+1}{y-3}$e is: If $sy-3$e is $s0$e , the answer would be non-permissible. $$sy=3$$e Example The non-permissible value(s) for $$s\frac{2a^2+4a-48}{3a^2+3a-60}$$e $$s=\frac{3(a+6)}{2(a+5)}$$e is: $$sa\ne -5,4$$e

item.title: Operations on Polynomials
item.description: Polynomials can be added by adding each of the like terms in polynomials. Two polynomial expressions (includes functions) are equivalent if: they simplify to give the same expression, or they produce the same graph. Two polynomial functions are not equivalent if: they result in different values when they are evaluated with the same values substituted for the variable(s). How to subtract polynomials To subtract polynomials, rewrite the operation as an addition of negatives: Example $$s(2x^2-x)+(3x^2-2x+3)$$e $$s=5x^2-3x+3$$e Example When are $sxy+xz+yz$e and $sx^2+y^2+x^2$e equivalent?
